text:
Still figuring out a way to smoothly test my css, js, new modules, module changes etc.

My situation is as follows:
I have a site running in HubSpot, making new modules, adding new features to modules and creating new functionalities in js, the whole shabang. but I havent’ really found a nice way to test the new code i’m making..

ideally I want like a local/test/staging/live environment to go through all the right git stages and make sure that what comes live really is tested and a 100% good if you know what i mean..

But now: i’m only running my local environment which then pushes my changes to the live environment. i’m kinda missing my “sandbox” here.. a sandbox that includes all my pages..

it’s really a TL;DR, i’m aware of this, but if anybody knows some good stuff, please let me know, thanks!
Hi. We need to mass update contacts by updating some properties. This isn't an import but an update. What is the best way to do this? Through API? THanks

Random question! I want to embed the calendar form but once it is completed I want it to lead to a specific page after completed. Is there a way I can dynamically pass an ID so it can lead to the correct page?
I think I found a solution, if anyone else has experience with this. <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Pass-field-value-to-URL-parameter/td-p/240551>
x-posting for visibility late on a friday

@general Im looking to create a pop-up that opens whenever a visitor on our website clicks any one of two items in the navigation bar (the number of instances will likely increase in the future) the pop-up would then contain text informing the visitor they will be redirected, and then the visitor will need to click accept to be redirected. We operate with public funds and heavy compliance so this is a requirement for launch. Any advice or development help is greatly appreaciated.

Hi folks

I have HubSpot 2 apps connected to 2 HubSpot accounts - I need to transfer ownership from the app to an other developper - but I don’t see how I can share/give permission within the app interface, any idea ?
